title: Don't miss this!
text: The Acropolis is the jewel of Athens! It houses the Parthenon (beautiful!), Erechtheion (a Temple dedicated to both Athena and Poseidon), Theatre of Dionysus (built in the 4th century), Temple of Athena Nike (ionic temple built around 420 BC), Odeon of Herodes Atticus (stone theatre built in 161 AD), and many ruins and bits of ruins, bits of statues just lying around. Don't miss this! Oh, and bring a sun hat or a parasol, plenty of water, sunscreen, and your camera!

title: A must see!
text: If you're spending any time in Athens, the museum is a must-see! The exhibits are beautiful! The bonus is the ancient Athenian neighbourhood under the Acropolis Museum that showcases an excavation spanning 4th c. BC to 12th c. AD.

title: Great food, beautiful location, friendly staff
text: Wonderful food and wine in the Plaka. Beautiful location, shaded by lovely greenery. Friendly staff. Wonderful food. I went a couple times because it was so good. Great place for solo travelers or for groups. Souvlaki is excellent, so is their fish dishes.

title: Fun, but not an adrenaline rush
text: I had to try this. 11 stories up, flying over the crowds but beneath the canopy of lights and music. I had built up this experience in my mind too much it seems because after a waiting in line, being organized, getting fitted with a harness, waiting for your turn (nice view up there though!), being hooked up, and having your picture taken, you finally get launched out. I'm afraid of heights, but this didn't frighten me at all. 30-45 seconds later, you arrive at the other end. The jerk backwards at the end gave me more of a rush than the zipline unfortunately. Still, it's great for a lot of people. Not expensive by Vegas standards, and you get to say you did it. There are a ton of photos taken. $20 for one or $40-45 for all. If you're with a friend, get all of them and split the cost.

title: So many great works!
text: Had a really nice visit here. This gallery is amazing! Works by Magritte, Calder, Bertho, Francis, Goins, Haring, Deyber, Chagall, Lichtenstein, Warhol, Fressinier, Basquiat, Kourpour, Picasso, Muniz, Kondakova, Faine, Hirst, Lalonde, Kostabi, Hofmann, Hallam, Miró, Nicholls, Dalí, Erté and Haring.

title: Unexpected fun!
text: Ok, the fun was not totally unexpected, but it exceeded my expectations. The bartender was amazing and made the experience even more amazing with his knowledge of the area. The scenery is spectacular! Definitely worth the visit!

title: Such a high energy, fun show!
text: It's simple - don't miss this show! High energy, amazing voices, extremely engaged, super fun group equals one hell of a great event! Get out of your seat and dance!

title: Oh so tasty! Fresh, housemade deliciousness!
text: This unassuming little place is a butcher's first and foremost, but it is also a little grill where they serve a fantastic shwarma, hand-cut fries, and house-made ginger ale! And to top it all off, you are always served with a friendly smile. If you're in the mood to chat a little, ask the butcher/host about his food and products. He takes pride in ownership and it's so wonderful to see someone light up when they speak passionately about the business they love. If you're in the neighborhood do not pass up a chance to eat here.

title: Beautiful atmosphere, but super pricey
text: The Bard is definitely a beautiful building and the interior boasts a lot of rich, dark woods, gorgeous chandeliers, and an atmosphere of the old world. What this means however, is that you will definitely pay for it through the price of the food and alcohol! A glass of wine that is typically $7 or $8 elsewhere, will run you $10 to $14 here. The food is ok, but not really worth the price. The servers are always friendly and helpful however. If you want a beautiful place to eat, and don't mind paying a little too much for what you're served, then sure, why not go here. This is more of a touristy type place rather than a place where the locals hang out.

title: I never tire of this place
text: I'm a local and I love this little corner of the city. The shops full of curious little trinkets, the wonderful food, the fresh produce every morning, the hidden alleyways (Fantan is very popular, but don't miss Dragon Alley on the other side of the street), the decorated street lamps painted red and gold , and of course the Gate of Harmonious Interest that welcome everyone. It's beautiful any time of year, but especially in the spring when the cherry blossoms are in bloom.

title: Fav coffee location
text: There are many cafes in Victoria, but if you want a really great coffee, friendly staff, and a comfortable environment with a touch of modern then this is the place to stop by. It's a favorite of the locals, so that should tell you something!

title: Super yum!
text: Great place for a quick bite. Friendly staff, great food (try the chicken bowl!!), inexpensive, in a quirky little restaurant.

title: Pleasant stay, clean room, fantastic staff
text: I stayed here in the beginning of June on a business trip. At first I was a little concerned with the reviews that complained about the noise from the freeway, but found this to not be a problem at all. The room was very comfortable, large, clean (this is very important to me), and had all that I needed. While the room may not be 5 star (a very shiny 3), the staff certainly are 5 star! They are extremely helpful, and very friendly - all of them! Front desk, lounge, housekeepers... all had a cheerful "Good morning", "hello", a quick chat, or a warm smile. It's stuff like this that keeps a person coming back. If I am in the area for business again, I will definitely be staying here.
place: Holiday Inn Express Portland SE-Clackamas Area

title: Buy peanuts before going!
text: Peanuts in the shell. Non-salted. Squirrels will gently take them from your hands, peacocks will try to be gentle, the geese, not so much... :) Duck food can be purchased from Bulk Barn downtown. Don't feed them bread! Bring your camera to photograph the wildlife and the beautiful scenery, especially when all the flowers are in bloom. A beautiful park to visit any time of day and any time of year. Oh! And don't forget to visit the petting zoo.... even if you don't have children.

title: Not very friendly, warn out and old
text: Upon arriving, we were not even acknowledged.... stood at the counter for a couple minutes before even being blandly welcomed. No smile even. Room was the smallest, most cramped one I've ever been in... This was the room for the military "discount". For an extra $20 we would have had a bigger, nicer room with a balcony. Guess they don't appreciate military service. The room was pretty clean, but very old and very worn. Wallpaper was ripped, carpeting needs to be replaced and the smoke alarm in the room next door was going off. Same poor customer service on check out. Didn't ask how the stay was. No smile again. Nothing. Not worth staying here. Spend the extra $30 for a much better hotel elsewhere.

title: Comfortable atmosphere, friendly staff
text: Great place to unwind after a long week. Good wine, friendly staff, relaxing atmosphere, and decent menu.

title: Local fav
text: This place has something for everyone: the Wicket restaurant, Games Room bar, the Clubhouse dance club, Rooftop bar with volleyball court. The Wicket's menu has a great selection of tasty "pub grub", staff is friendly and cheerful, atmosphere is fun and upbeat. Great place to unwind and have fun.

title: Great dive bar
text: Great for an after party drink or two... Definitely a dive bar, but needs to be visited. Peanut shells litter the floor, country music blares over the speakers, beer is free flowing, and bras decorate every nook and cranny. It's a hot mess and fun as hell!

title: Great little attraction
text: I'm a local, but still love this little alley with its boutique shops, and a step back into time. If you are visiting Victoria, don't miss this little gem in the heart of Chinatown.

title: Fab Gallery!
text: Stunning gallery with a variety of incredible works ranging from paintings, sculptures, and jewelry. It's definitely worth visiting if you are a lover of fine art!

title: Not just a tourist attraction
text: Beautiful area of float homes and cheap eats. Very picturesque, so bring your camera! Don't miss the friendly sea life that likes to pop up and visit (seals and otters especially)! (Please remember that locals live here, and while they are quite friendly, please be respectful of their property and privacy.)

title: Do not miss this show!
text: Absolutely incredible show! I wanted a "vintage Vegas" trip, and this show delivered! Every single person in this production delivered a performance I will never forget. I was transfixed as they transformed the stage into a Vegas of days-gone-by; they crooned, belted, sang, danced, pranced, hula-hooped, performed, played, and entertained! Do not miss this show!

title: Entertaining and FREE!
text: Stuck around to watch a couple of the fountain performances and really enjoyed watching the fountains dance to great music. Great opportunity for photos as well. And best of all... It's FREE!

title: Pretty, but small...
text: Not sure what I was expecting... More plants? Live plants? A larger area? Still, the display was pretty and it offered a nice little break from the casino environment.

title: Amazing and educational!
text: I really loved this museum. It was very educational, informative, and interesting! They mix it up with some interactive experiences here and there to keep things interesting, and provide some great videos as well. Highly recommend this attraction. Oh, and plan to spend around 3 hours here!

title: Beautiful views
text: The elevator ride up the tower was a little too thrilling for me (standing at the front, almost pressed up against the glass with nothing to hold on to left me feeling a little queasy! But, this isn't a complaint; it just added to the experience. At the top, the 360 degree view is simply stunning! Bring your camera. The wait time to go up wasn't very long (about 10 minutes).

title: Exciting and fun!
text: Don't miss spending time at the Freemont Experience. The overhead shows are great, the entertainment is fantastic (and free!), the casinos are exciting, and people watching is spectacular! I loved the vibrant energy of the entire street!

title: What can I say? It's a Cheesecake Factory.... but GREAT service
text: It's a Cheesecake Factory - a typical chain restaurant... but the service here was out of this world. My friend mentioned she was chilly, and the server came by with warmed napkins for her shoulders! We were served with smiles, pleasant chit chat, an appropriate amount of attentiveness (she was not annoying at all), and all 'round great service. I really wish I knew the server's name so I could let the manager know what a great asset this restaurant has. The food? Well, it's chain food, but I admit it was pretty tasty.

title: Very nice food, great atmosphere, incredible service
text: I was here for lunch and despite there being great items on the menu, I opted for a burger since I hadn't had one in months! It was juicy and full of flavour; I was quite impressed. The fries were a little too thin for my liking (they got cold fast), but they were still tasty. My friend and I were seated across from the expansive salt water fish tank - it was huge! I found I kept watching the fish and they swam back and forth, around and around, darting in and out of the reef. The service was superb! Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, pleasant, and always had a smile. Great restaurant!

title: Tastiest brain freeze ever
text: Alcoholic slushies in almost every flavour imaginable... need I say more? I suppose I can add that you can sample every single flavor available, if you so desire. Oh, and don't be fooled by the skinny neck on the half-yard! There is a LOT of alcohol in there! lol. The souvenir cup is a nice touch, too.

title: Clean, comfortable, economical
text: Clean, comfortable hotel with friendly staff in all departments. The Irish pub gets rockin' during the weekend, but it has decent food and a fun atmosphere. The restaurant inside has a nice menu, and a large breakfast buffet. The bar has extremely friendly staff that is knowledgeable about the area. Not a luxury hotel, but a decent 3 star stay. Oh, and SkyTrain is very close by; convenient!

title: Beautiful hotel, great staff - they saved me from a horrid B&B
text:
I stayed at this hotel in August 2009 and what a treasure it is! From the friendly, helpful, courteous staff, to the large, clean, tasteful room with a gorgeous view of the Promenade, this hotel has it all. No complaints whatsoever - I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone. After I arrived on the IOM, I checked into a little B&B that I had booked online.

I was trying to travel on a bit of a budget (traveling alone and went to the IOM to do some family research) and selected the B&B due to cost, and the room seemed clean and tidy from what I could find of the pictures. I was oh so wrong! It was a horrible place so I immediately went in search of something more to my liking.

It didn't take long for me to come across the Sefton and upon explaining my situation, I was treated to a wonderful angel who gave me a great rate for an incredible room - she truly salvaged my little vacation/family research trip and helped make my stay a most wonderful one.

The room was lovely, the grounds wonderful, the beach spectacular, the staff friendly and professional, the food tasty and the all around atmosphere incredible!
